title: Indiana Fever Star Makes History Against Liberty
description: The Indiana Fever have a reason to be happy.

html:
Jul 16, 2025 9:16 PM EDT

While much of the focus on the Indiana Fever is on Caitlin Clark and her immediate future after her latest injury, Kelsey Mitchell provided fans a reason to celebrate and be optimistic about their future.

On Wednesday, against the New York Liberty, Mitchell made history with her hot start for the Fever. While Indiana struggled and trailed 53-38 in the first half, the All-Star guard was sensational with 13 points on 4-of-8 shooting.

Mitchell also made two 3-pointers out of four attempts, which allowed her to claim the record for the most triples in franchise history.

The 29-year-old scorer entered the game with 605 career 3-pointers with the Fever, just one behind Tamika Catchings‚Äô tally of 606.

‚ÄúFRANCHISE RECORD,‚Äù the Fever wrote to celebrate Mitchell‚Äôs achievement. ‚ÄúKelsey Mitchell has passed Tamika Catchings for the most three-pointers made in franchise history with 607 and counting.‚Äù

Oops! We‚Äôre unable to load this content right now.

View directly on ùïè

Fans were also quick to celebrate the moment, taking to the comments section of the Fever‚Äôs post to congratulate the veteran scorer and heap praise on her.

‚ÄúKelsey Mitchell is a Fever legend. She stayed with the team through a 5-31 record and is now reaping the rewards,‚Äù a commenter wrote. Another one said, ‚ÄúCongrats Kelsey. Keep it coming.‚Äù

‚ÄúQueen Goat,‚Äù a fan declared.

‚ÄúCongrats kels. You were one of our famous Splash Sisters last year until White changed everything,‚Äù a supporter remarked.

A follower added, ‚ÄúCongrats Kelsey! Keep firing!‚Äù

‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go Kelsey Mitchell. Money as always and now the franchise three leader,‚Äù a social media user shared.

Mitchell also climbed the WNBA‚Äôs all-time 3-pointers made, claiming the 11th spot from Catchings. She now has a chance to crack the top 10 of the list, with Jewell Loyd up next at No. 10 with 610 triples.

Angelo Guinhawa
